channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 positive individuals can’t vote – Comelec
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Voters testing positive for COVID-19 and still completing isolation will not be allowed by the Commission on Elections (Comelec) to cast their ballots in the May 9, 2022 national and local elections.

item.title: Bill seeks increased benefits for HCWs
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: A measure seeking to increase the government’s grant of hazard pay and other benefits for healthcare workers has been filed in the House of Representatives.

item.title: Freezing assets of Pharmally execs, others sought
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Leila de Lima has pressed for the freezing of assets of former presidential adviser on economic affairs Michael Yang, former undersecretary Christopher Lloyd Lao and officials of Pharmally.

item.title: Edward Go, ex-PhilSTAR board member, 83
item.description: Edward S. Go, a member of the board of directors of Philstar Daily Inc., publisher of The Philippine STAR, passed away on Sept. 16. He was 83.

item.title: Budget realignments seen as House plenary deliberations set to start
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: House plenary deliberations on the proposed P5-trillion national budget for next year is set to start in the coming week and realignments to fund continuing pandemic response programs could be expected.

item.title: Stamps honoring Olympic, COVID-19 heroes launched
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The Philippine Postal Corporation officially launched yesterday the stamps honoring the country’s first ever Olympic gold medalist Hidilyn Diaz and her fellow medalists in the Tokyo Olympics, as well as the “Keep the Faith, Be A Hero” stamps, which aim to encourage the public to get vaccinated.

item.title: DOH reports 23,134 new COVID-19 infections; active cases at 184,088
item.description: The Department of Health said the total confirmed cases in the country were 2,347,550.

item.title: Philippines gets new batch of Moderna COVID-19 jabs
item.description: A China Airlines carrying 961,000 Moderna jabs landed at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport in Pasay City past 3 p.m.

item.title: DOH: COVID-19 test kits procured through PS-DBM 'not near expiry'
item.description: “The COVID-19 RT-PCR test kits with six months shelf life are not near expiry, as that was the standard shelf life of those novel diagnostic test kits at the time,” DOH Undersecretary Charade Mercado-Grande said.

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Metro Manila haven't peaked yet, DOH says
item.description: The Department of Health said Saturday that COVID-19 cases in Metro Manila have not yet peaked, countering preliminary projections mde by a fellow of the private think tank OCTA Research Group.
